data.description: Creation of Aadhaar card enables basic documentation for banks and government services.

notes.note: Component 1 - Base Number: 24 (90 - 66, number of school admissions supported by team Protsahan)
notes.working_rationale:
Component 1:
Base Number: 24 (90 - 66, no. of school admissions supported by team Protsahan).
Calculation: 1500 (estimated cost of chronic illness treatment) * Base Number * 12 months.

Component 2:
Base Number: 66 (Girl champions, children - younger population).
Calculation: 1500 (estimated cost of chronic illness treatment) * Base Number * 4 (Health services availed once per year).

Total - Component 1 + Component 2.

monetary_compensation_breakdown.message: No data available for this category

notes.remarks: 8 Ration Cards supported by team & Ration Cards unlocked for 24 more adults.

notes.working_rationale: Base Number: 24 (Ration cards unlocked via Aadhaar Card) + 8 (supported by team) = 32. Avg. cost of basic household groceries = INR 5000. Average lifespan of an Indian = 71 years, assuming the age of community members to be in the range of 25-30 years; they may avail the benefits of the ration card for approx. 37 more years for 12 months per year. Calculation = Base number * 5000 * 37 * 12.

data.monetary_compensation: Linked with bank account and PM Jan Dhan Yojna - INR 1500
Up to 1000 per month for 2 children

notes.working_rationale: -1000 x 12 (months in a year) until they reach the age of 18. Assuming the age of the children to be at least 10 years, the individual may avail the benefit of the labour card for at least 8 years. Calculation = 12000 * number of labour card(s) * 8.

data.monetary_compensation:
- Cooked meal every day - INR 30/meal for children (Mon-Sat) 
- Immunization vaccination 
- Refer children to schools for admission

notes.working_rationale: Component 1 - Overall cost of getting a COVID vaccination from a private hospital/clinic: INR 800. Calculation = No. of vaccine registrations * 800 = amount unlocked. Component 2 - 353 * 6 * T10.
Calculation= 50,000 *  No. of women connected (as it is a one-time aid)
